name: callously
content:

in a way that is unkind, cruel, and without sympathy or feeling for other people: She was callously indifferent to the suffering of those she made jobless. He callously uses the people around him. See
callous
More examplesFewer examplesSome coal operators are accused of callously disregarding the mine safety laws.She was treated callously at the clinic on many occasions.There is a tendency to callously believe that those who do not survive the disease are those who did not fight hard enough.
